q2.text:

q2.summary: Amazon S3 is an object storage service offering scalability, security, and performance for various use cases, with multiple storage classes tailored to different needs.
This documentation provides reference and procedural guidance on Amazon S3 features, including Storage Lens, inventory management, performance optimization, and hosting static websites.

This documentation provides an overview of Amazon S3, its features, storage classes, access management, and related tools for accessing and managing data in the cloud. It also includes guidance on setting up and using Amazon S3 effectively.

It also advises against pinning TLS certificates and suggests ongoing monitoring with AWS Config rules.

It emphasizes implementing least privilege access and avoiding long-term credentials in applications.
